node_proc module¶

Four functions which create Node’s in syntax trees.

node_proc.new_c_node()¶

Creates a new conjoined sentence (C) node, initializing it with appropriate defaults for a C-node type.

Returns

A newly initialized C-node

Return type

Node

node_proc.new_e_node()¶

Creates a new elaborated copy (E) node, initializing it with appropriate defaults for an E-node type.

Returns

A newly initialized E-node

Return type

Node

node_proc.new_n_node()¶

Creates a new noun phrase (N) node, initializing it with appropriate defaults for an N-node type.

Returns

A newly initialized N-node

Return type

Node

node_proc.new_node(id)¶
Parameters

id (NodeId) –

Return type

Node

node_proc.new_s_node()¶

Creates a new sentence (S) node, initializing it with appropriate defaults for an S-node type.

Returns

A newly initialized S-node

Return type

Node

node_proc.node_proc_reset()¶

Resets the global node counter used to assign unique identification numbers to new nodes.

Return type

None

modern module

parse_proc module
